pros: Great place, great guidance, supportive staff.
cons: The pay could be better, not going to lie

review_title: Great employees, leadership not so great
pros: The students, faculty, and staff create a sense of family. Everybody was very friendly. Affordable benefits
cons: President and VPs appear out of touch. Pay isn't that great

job_title: Physician Assistant Student in Albuquerque, NM
pros: Will end up with a great degree.
cons: Faculty are not empathetic toward students

pros: Great coworkers Understanding environment Some of your managers care about you
cons: Leadership makes bad decisions constantly If you aren't a Christian you probably won't feel comfortable here The job is incredibly thankless

pros: Great Staff and Administration. Good kids.
cons: I don't have anything negative to say

pros: Great colleagues who care about each other
cons: Management only cares about the number of students in the seat. They do not care about the quality of education. Not enough support for students. Many faculty teaching courses that they are not qualified to teach.

pros: Flexible schedules and healthy environment
cons: Smaller school, doesn’t fit all students environment

pros: Flexibility with schedule, creative town hall meetings held by Institutional Diversity department, student body
cons: Low pay, administration/management, invalidating, enmeshment from faculty with students, communication, consistency, emphasis more of finances than the students

pros: Complete benefit package is generous. Graduated 403B match up to 10%, tuition benefit for self/spouse (including grad programs), children. Also part of three tuition exchange programs. Co-workers are wonderful.
cons: Salary on low side, but they were making some progress on bringing people to market targets before COVID. Runs pretty lean on people resources.

pros: Flexible work hours, good location
cons: Tends to get loud at times

review_title: OK place to work is you are desperate
pros: Good benefits, vacation time, and felxibility
cons: A lot of nasty, petty people. They do not hire people who are qualified for their jobs. It is all based on who you know and if you have a friend or relative already working there.  That is who gets hired. There are people in management who worked as cleaning ladies, cashiers, etc. who have no skills or management ability.  They also make it a practice of NOT advertising the job externally and letting supervisors hire whoever they want. These supervisors hire their friends. The outcome is a place that is inbred and highly dysfunctional. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

pros: Great boss and interesting work
cons: Sometimes cold-calling which is never fun

review_title: It has sadly gone down hill
pros: Used to be the best place to work. FAMILY. Before "new" president ruled with iron fist. Wonderful instructors and employees who are trying to make the best of a horrible situation. The employees there are wonderful! They are student centered.
cons: The president has no heart, which was the center of St. Francis and all he stood for. So sad to see a wonderful institution go down as quickly as he is taking it. I truly worry that there will be no USF in a few years as he has chosen. He has laid so many employees off and there are going to be more on the way to cover expenses.  So very sad...

review_title: Arvid Johnson is a money grubbing President
pros: There are some good people that still work there and care about the university and the students.
cons: Then they started firing people, letting people go that have been there for over 20 years, putting new and not qualified people into managing roles. Its going downhill. Feel bad for the students that pay a ridiculous amount of money to go there and most of the programs are years behind current trends and technology.

pros: Health insurance, paid vacation/sick, retirement.
cons:
Hiring and promotions are based on office politics rather than work performance and qualifications.

Negative work environment, possibly a result of low pay.  The pay structure is top heavy. Employees are underpaid while managers are over paid.  

Lack of leadership skills of department managers.

review_title: It was an ok place to work for a while.
pros: It's an ok place to work while you are waiting for your next opportunity. The pay is fair in comparison to other places.
cons: It seems to be a place where your success is very dependent upon office politics and red tape. It's mostly about who you know.

review_title: University of St. Francis Needs to Fire the Non-Performing Lifers
pros: Good benefits, vacation and sick days.  Flexibility is good.
cons: Hiring incompetent people who have no skill set for the jobs and keeping bad people on because they are "legacy hires" (their whole family worked there).

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New Lenox, IL
pros: People are nice at  the University of St. Francis if you do not get in the clicks there and the hours are good for family life.
cons: The University keeps upper management when going through lay offs. The small underpaid people are always the ones they let go.

pros: People working there are dedicated to their positions and genuinely excited to try and make their area the best it can be.
cons: Not a lot of room for promotion or advancement. Many areas are over worked and have limited resources. Pay seems best at director or above levels but not below.

pros: Welcoming campus ... good benefits ... opportunities to serve the community
cons: Small campus ...  not much to do in the neighborhood
